column4: Can anyone help me figure out why Synaptic is telling me these packages can be auto-removed? http://mystic.de4th.com/stuff/Screenshot.png
you probably had a legacy gnome app installed, and you removed it. So, synaptic says you don't need it's support libs anymore
If I get rid of those packages, I'll be getting rid of things that seem very important.
what do you have that's still using those? I mean, there's not much left that needs the gnome 1.4 libs now that gnucash has finally been ported
Well, I installed sanduhr earlier but decided it was crap..
yes, that's exactly what brought those in: look at apt-cache show sanduhr
Ah, seems like you're right; it's depending on old stuff. So it really is safe to remove it all?
if you had, those wouldn't be ready for removal.
Alright. Thanks for helping a somewhat paranoid user. :)
paranoia is only perception: understanding is improving perception :)
Great way to look at it.
~/.backgrounds for your personal ones
and /usr/share/backgrounds for the system wide ones
Do I just list the directories to use?
hrm, I just drop the backgrounds I want into ~/.backgrounds, or link them there
It doesn't seem to work. I symlinked .backgrounds to my wallpapers folder..
funny, I know I did that before. It's not working here, either
Perhaps the custom directory name has changed?
no, I dropped a picture onto the change background dialog, and that's where it ended up
I also did a killall nautilus.
maybe a logout and login is what it takes. Not doing so now, though
Logging out and back in didn't seem to work.
